Class Cell

java.lang.Object
Cell
public abstract class Cell extends Object
A class representing the shared characteristics of all forms of life

2022.01.06

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    act()
    Make this cell act - that is: the cell decides it's status in the next generation This super method consists of actions required to be checked by all cells (except the creeper) Called by all cells except the Creeper (therefore creeper is immune to the disease) If stateDetermined = true, the cell's state is definately determined Else, the cell still needs to be determined (by its own conditions), may still be dead/alive Order of precedence: creeper, infected, cell-specific rules

  • Constructor Details

    • Cell

      public Cell(Field field, Location location, Color defaultColour)
      Create a new cell at location in field.
      Parameters:
      field - The field currently occupied.
      location - The location within the field.
      defaultColour - the default color of the cell.

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act()
      Make this cell act - that is: the cell decides it's status in the next generation This super method consists of actions required to be checked by all cells (except the creeper) Called by all cells except the Creeper (therefore creeper is immune to the disease) If stateDetermined = true, the cell's state is definately determined Else, the cell still needs to be determined (by its own conditions), may still be dead/alive Order of precedence: creeper, infected, cell-specific rules

    • aggroCreeperSearch

      protected boolean aggroCreeperSearch()
      Search if any neighbour is an active creeper
      Returns:
      true if a neighbour is a creeper cell in its aggro state

    • cellSearchQuantity

      protected int cellSearchQuantity(Class<?> cellType)
      Search if any neighbour is of a certain type CellType needs to be in the form of Creeper.class etc.
      Parameters:
      cellType - specified cell type.
      Returns:
      the amount of neighbours of a specified cell type

    • isAlive

      protected boolean isAlive()
      Check whether the cell is alive or not.
      Returns:
      true if the cell is still alive.

    • setDead

      protected void setDead()
      Indicate that the cell is no longer alive.

    • setNextState

      public void setNextState(boolean value)
      Indicate that the cell will be alive or dead in the next generation.
      Parameters:
      value - true if cell will be alive in the next generation.
